graph

Interface Graph


  • public interface Graph
    This interface represent the graph, which has vertices and edges
    Author:
    Gauchoux, Robilliard

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Edge addEdge(Vertex vertexSource, Vertex vertexEnd)
      Create a new Edge in this graph, going from the source vertex to the target vertex, and returns the created edge.
      void addEdge(Vertex vertex1, Vertex vertex2, Edge edge)
      Adds the specified edge to this graph, going from the source vertex to the target vertex.
      void addVertex(Vertex vertex)
      Adds the specified vertex to this graph if not already present.
      java.lang.Boolean containsEdge(Edge e)
      Returns true if this graph contains the specified edge.
      java.lang.Boolean containsEdge(Vertex sourceVertex, Vertex targetVertex)
      Returns true if and only if this graph contains an edge going from the source vertex to the target vertex.
      java.lang.Boolean containsVertex(Vertex v)
      Returns true if this graph contains the specified vertex.
      Edge getEdges(Vertex sourceVertex, Vertex targetVertex)
      Returns an edge connecting source vertex to target vertex if such vertices and such edge exist in this graph.
      Vertex getEdgeSource(Edge e)
      Returns the source vertex of an edge.
      Vertex getEdgeTarget(Edge e)
      Returns the target vertex of an edge.
      void removeEdge(Edge e)
      Removes the specified edge from the graph.
      void removeVertex(Vertex v)
      Removes the specified vertex from this graph including all its touching edges if present.
